portraits.title: Vivek PV
portraits.subtitle: 15, Student
portraits.description: "I feel pride in our tradition of Theyyam. This vibrant culture, deeply rooted in our village, especially in Kannur's kavus, brings me joy and makes me proud of our heritage."

portraits.title: Rabindran
portraits.subtitle: 70, Electrician and Plumber
portraits.description: "Theyyam, is integral to our daily lives. It is unique and is simply part of who we are."

portraits.title: Saji
portraits.subtitle: 40, Tourism Professional and English Teacher
portraits.description: "Theyyam is an essential part of our lives, especially for Hindus. It represents the cultural and spiritual essence of our community."

portraits.title: Thushara
portraits.subtitle: 40, Educator
portraits.description: "This is me experiencing Theyyam for the first time and it's awesome. There is so much energy and beauty—it feels like something you I can experience again and again."

portraits.title: Rajesh
portraits.subtitle: 47, Finance Manager
portraits.description: "Theyyam, to us, is not just an art form—it is a deity, a divine experience that embodies the natural beauty and spiritual essence of Kerala."

portraits.title: Ishan
portraits.subtitle: 12, Student
portraits.description: "I really like Kerala. Kerala is a special to live with so many gods and goddesses, each representing something unique."

portraits.title: Naresh Roy
portraits.subtitle: 39, Cane Craft Artisan
portraits.description: "Kerala is a beautiful place, but I feel sometimes people let greed overshadow their humility. There's a sense of superiority that creeps in, and it's something we must address."

portraits.title: Suresh
portraits.subtitle: 57, Wood Carver
portraits.description: "I have dedicated 46 years of my life to wood carving, including intricate pieces like the elephant carving at the front. My craft is my pride and my contribution to Kerala's artistic heritage."

portraits.title: Sani
portraits.subtitle: 38, Painter
portraits.description: "I do not know much. I work here."

portraits.title: Ajaya Kumar
portraits.subtitle: 62, Tourism Guide
portraits.description: "Kerala is a treasure trove of experiences—visit the waterfalls, explore the forests, enjoy the street food. There's so much to discover and love."

portraits.title: Narayanan
portraits.subtitle: 70, Security Guard
portraits.description: "What can I say about Kerala? It is wonderful, it is beautiful, and it is my home. I couldn't imagine being anywhere else."

portraits.title: Shejith
portraits.subtitle: 50, Tax Consultant
portraits.description: "When you are in Kerala, visit the beaches, mosques, temples. The more you explore, the more amazing Kerala gets."

portraits.title: Salim
portraits.subtitle: 45, Chow Constructor
portraits.description: "I am from Gujrat. I am here in Kerala to work, and I like the place"

portraits.title: Sathvin
portraits.subtitle: 58, Company Owner
portraits.description: "Kerala truly is 'God's Own Country'—a land of unparalleled beauty, clean air, and a charm that is uniquely its own."

portraits.title: Dr. Jisha CK
portraits.subtitle: 43, Assistant Professor
portraits.description: "Kerala is my home, and it always will be. No matter where I go, I find myself missing its comfort and familiarity."

portraits.title: Mohamud Koya
portraits.subtitle: 80, Retired Government Worker
portraits.description: "Uttichira is my home and it's the best. There are a lot of Muslims here"

portraits.title: Badayakandy Basheer
portraits.subtitle: 69, Businessman
portraits.description: "I've traveled to 38 countries, but nowhere compares to Kerala — a land of educated people, abundant natural resources, and vibrant business opportunities. It's truly one of a kind."

portraits.title: Yasir Kurikkal
portraits.subtitle: 41, Practioner/Teacher of Kalari
portraits.description: "Kalari is more than just a martial art—it's a legacy of Kerala, passed down through generations, connecting us to our ancestors and preserving our rich traditions. I learned it from my father and now I teach it to my son."
